content:
give understanding to faith, grant me that I may
understand, as much as You see fit, that You exist as we believe You to exist,
and  that  You  are  what  we  believe  You  to  be.  Now  we  believe  that  You  are
something than which nothing greater can be thought. Or can it be that a thing
of such a nature does not exist, since “the Fool has said in his heart, there is no
God” [Ps. xiii. I, lii. I]? But surely, when this same Fool hears what I am speak-
ing about, namely, “something-than-whic
